GPTIntroduction.Purpose: The purpose/goal of this GPT is help you understand the Safety Design Method, which is the framework telling you what aspects you should consider to desgin a safe product throughout the product life cycle.
what GPT can do: Tailored questions to guide your thinking.
Evaluations of your responses, helping you refine and improve your design.
Brainstorming prompts to explore creative ideas.
Reflection exercises to ensure your design meets both safety and functional needs.
GPTIntroduction.RecommendedUsage: If you're using the GPT for the first time, we recommend exploring as many steps as possible to get a thorough understanding of safety considerations throughout the product's developmentâ€”from creation to disposal. You're welcome to dive deeper into any topics that interest you, and if you'd like to practice some exercises, you can request feedback. The GPT also offers reflective questions to help you self-assess your progress and performance.

content.description: The method will have 15 steps matching with 15 phases of product life cycle. Each step how what aspects users need to consider.
content.Core idea: When designing a product with safety in mind, you need to consider 6 aspects: human factors, the system/product itself, the environment, and their interactions. It's important not only to focus on user safety during product use but also to think about how the product is manufactured, how it can be recycled, and the risks associated with misuse, etc. In other words, this approach helps you consider the entire product life cycle.

steps.name: Stakeholders and their needs
steps.description: This step focuses on identifying and addressing the needs and interests of stakeholders within a system to ensure safety. This step will help you to balance the needs of different stakeholders.

steps.name: System concept, system definition and system environment
steps.description: This step focuses on defining roughly what functions the products should have, what technical requirements are to achieve that functions, and how the product can be operated. Also understanding the influence of environment on a product.

steps.name: System (safety) objectives
steps.description: The product goals can sometimes compete or even conflict with each other (e.g., reliability versus cost). Therefore, in this step, we help you create a reflection on your priority in goals. Also, we guide you to set achievable goals based on standards and regulations.

steps.name: Safety risk assessment and acceptance criteria
steps.description: Hazards that can lead to safety failures and their associated risks shall be identified, evaluated and assessed. we will show you how to do all of that.

steps.name: Specification of system (safety) functions and requirements
steps.description: After knowing what risks your product could pose to users and the environments, it's time to create product functions and requirements to minimise those risks.

steps.name: Architecting a safe system
steps.description: what sub-systems of a product must be to achieve the set functions and requirements. You want to organise them into a product architecture.

steps.name: System (safety) design
steps.description: Understanding how to integrate the sub-systems to create the completed product is also important. Here is how

steps.name: Residual safety risk assessment and acceptance
steps.description: Of course it is difficult to ensure that your product is not 100% safe in all situations. There must be some remaining risks but is it still acceptable to produce your product? Let's find out

steps.name: Production, integration, test and validation
steps.description: Want to dive deep into production settings and tests? Check here

steps.name: Packaging, transportation, installation, certification and preparation for the operation
steps.description: Taking care of these aspects, then your product is finally ready to use

steps.name: Operation and required performance
steps.description: Concern about how your product can be used or misused. What are the scenarios?

steps.name: Maintenance, support, faults and logistics
steps.description: Maintenance after using the product is also crucial; we can direct you to investigate.

steps.name: Human factors and culture
steps.description: You want to modify your product to different cultures and countries. We can help

steps.name: Safety risk monitoring, control, and communication
steps.description: In case of unexpected failure, what should you do?

steps.name: Retirement and disposal or reuse
steps.description: always good to plan the end of your product's life. We can show you what you could consider
